question.content:
**Which of the following expressions is equivalent to $0.12 \times 0.7$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content:
Let's rewrite the decimals in fraction form. Then we can use the properties of multiplication to write an equivalent expression.

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.showPrompt: Can you show me an example?
options.explanation:
We are multiplying, so we can use the commutative and associative properties. Here's an example of how we can rearrange and group the fractions:

$\begin{align}
\blueE{1.23} \times \maroonD{0.045} &= \blueE{\dfrac{123}{100}} \times \maroonD{\dfrac{45}{1{,}000}}\\\\
&=\left(\blueE{123 \times \dfrac{1}{100}}\right) \times \left(\maroonD{45 \times \dfrac{1}{1{,}000}}\right)\\\\
&=\blueE{123}  \times \maroonD{45} \times \left(\blueE{\dfrac{1}{100}} \times \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{1{,}000}}\right)\\\\
&={123}  \times {45} \times {\dfrac{1}{100{,}000}}\\\\
&={123}  \times {45} \div 100{,}000
\end{align}$

hints.content:
$\begin{align}
\blueE{0.12} \times \maroonD{0.7} &= \blueE{\dfrac{12}{100}} \times \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}}\\\\
&=\left(\blueE{12 \times \dfrac{1}{100}}\right) \times \left(\maroonD{7 \times \dfrac{1}{10}}\right)
\end{align}$

We are multiplying, so we can use the commutative and associative properties. Let's rearrange and group the fractions.

$\begin{align}
\blueE{0.12} \times \maroonD{0.7} &= \blueE{\dfrac{12}{100}} \times \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}}\\\\
&=\left(\blueE{12 \times \dfrac{1}{100}}\right) \times \left(\maroonD{7 \times \dfrac{1}{10}}\right)\\\\
&=\blueE{12}  \times \maroonD{7} \times \left(\blueE{\dfrac{1}{100}} \times \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{10}}\right)\\\\
&={12}  \times {7} \times \purpleD{\dfrac{1}{1{,}000}} 
\end{align}$

The numbers $\purpleD{\dfrac{1}{1{,}000}}$ and $\goldE{1{,}000}$ are reciprocals of each other. So *multiplying* by $\purpleD{\dfrac{1}{1{,}000}}$ is the same as *dividing* by $\goldE{1{,}000}$.
